abstract: China’s investigation into whether four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto stole state documents may be treated as a commercial case rather than as espionage, Australia’s foreign minister said.
snippet: China’s investigation into whether four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto stole state documents may be treated as a commercial case rather than as espionage, Australia’s foreign minister said.
lead_paragraph: China’s investigation into whether four employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto stole state documents may be treated as a commercial case rather than an espionage case, Australia’s foreign affairs minister said Sunday.

headline.main: China May Ease Charges for Rio Tinto Workers
